data.chText: 烤面包片；吐司
data.enText: slices of bread that have been made brown and crisp by heating them on both sides in a toaster or under a grill

data.chText: 烤面包片加奶酪
data.enText: cheese on toast

data.chText: 一块烤面包片
data.enText: a piece of toast

data.chText: 两片 / 两整片烤面包片
data.enText: two slices/rounds of toast

data.chText: 干杯；祝酒；敬酒
data.enText: the act of a group of people wishing sb happiness, success, etc. by drinking a glass of sth, especially alcohol, at the same time

data.chText: 我提议为新娘新郎干杯。
data.enText: I'd like to propose a toast to the bride and groom.

data.chText: 委员会为这项新计划干杯。
data.enText: The committee drank a toast to the new project.

data.chText: （在某领域）广受赞誉的人，有口皆碑的人
data.enText: a person who is praised by a lot of people in a particular place because of sth that they have done well

data.chText: 她的演出使她在艺术节中备受推崇。
data.enText: The performance made her the toast of the festival.
be toast

data.chText: 会死；要完蛋
data.enText: to be likely to die or be destroyed

data.chText: 要是出一次错，你就完了。
data.enText: One mistake and you're toast.

data.chText: 为…举杯敬酒；为…干杯
data.enText: to lift a glass of wine, etc. in the air and drink it at the same time as other people in order to wish sb/sth success, happiness, etc.

data.chText: 人们举起香槟酒为这对幸福的伉俪干杯。
data.enText: The happy couple were toasted in champagne.

data.chText: 我们为新公司的成功干杯。
data.enText: We toasted the success of the new company.

data.chText: 烤（尤指面包）；把…烤得焦黄
data.enText: to make sth, especially bread, turn brown by heating it in a toaster or close to heat; to turn brown in this way

data.chText: 烤过的三明治
data.enText: a toasted sandwich

data.chText: 把这些坚果放在高温烤架下面烤熟。
data.enText: Place under a hot grill until the nuts have toasted.

data.chText: 烤火；取暖；使暖和
data.enText: to warm a part of your body by placing it near a fire

word_means: 广受赞誉的人，有口皆碑的人

means: (在某领域)广受赞誉的人，有口皆碑的人

data.enText: be toast

data.chText: 会死；要完蛋
data.enText: to be likely to die or be destroyed

data.chText: 要是出一次错，你就完了。
data.enText: One mistake and you're toast.

tr: slices of bread that have been toasted
a drink in honor of or to the health of a person or event

example: I'm a goner if this plan doesn't work

tr: a celebrity who receives much acclaim and attention
example: he was the toast of the town

tr: make brown and crisp by heating

example: Let us toast the birthday girl!
Let's drink to the New Year

value.def: Toast is bread which has been cut into slices and made brown and crisp by cooking at a high temperature.
When you toast something such as bread, you cook it at a high temperature so that it becomes brown and crisp.

example.ex: Toast the bread lightly on both sides.

value.def: When you drink a toast to someone or something, you drink some wine or another alcoholic drink as a symbolic gesture, in order to show your appreciation of them or to wish them success.

example.ex: Eleanor and I drank a toast to Miss Jacobs...
example.tran: 我和埃莉诺向雅各布斯小姐敬酒。

example.ex: At the end of the meal Burgoyne was asked to propose a toast.
example.tran: 用餐终了，伯戈因被邀请致祝酒词。

value.def: When you toast someone or something, you drink a toast to them.

example.ex: Party officials and generals toasted his health...
example.tran: 政党官员与军队将领为他的健康举杯祝酒。

value.def: If someone is the toast of a place, they are very popular and greatly admired there, because they have done something very successfully or well.

example.ex: She was the toast of Paris.
example.tran: 她是巴黎最受推崇的人。

value.tran: 深受敬慕的人;最受推崇的人

value.def: If someone is toast, you mean that they are certain to be defeated or destroyed.

example.ex: They know how to control, restrict and, if need be, throttle access, important to newspapers and absolutely vital to radio and television. And if you don't play the game, you're toast.
example.tran: 他们知道怎样控制、限制信息获取途径，而且如果需要，还会将其完全阻断，而这些途径对报纸来说很重要，对广播、电视更是极其关键。如果你不遵守游戏规则，你就完蛋了。

trans: 土司工坊；吐司工坊；土司工房
咖椰土司；咖椰烤面包；咖椰面包；椰蛋酱土司
